meanings: [명사] excitement; (격분) agitation, [동사] be[get] excited, work oneself up; (기뻐서) be thrilled; (화가 나서) get upset, lose one's cool

vlive.english: What are you going to do when you guys are aroused?

examples.korean: Fear and excitement suddenly flowed over me. 발음듣기 난 갑자기 두려움과 흥분이 엄습해 왔다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Fear and excitement suddenly flowed over me. 발음

examples.korean: to feel a surge/thrill/shiver of excitement 발음듣기 밀려드는/전율이 이는/몸이 오싹해지는 흥분을 느끼다 Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: to feel a surge/thrill/shiver of excitement 발음

examples.korean: The stadium was a seething cauldron of emotion. 발음듣기 경기장은 잔뜩 달아오른 흥분의 도가니였다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The stadium was a seething cauldron of emotion. 발음

examples.korean: She arrived late, looking hot and flustered. 발음듣기 그녀는 늦게 허둥지둥 흥분한 모습으로 도착했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: She arrived late, looking hot and flustered. 발음

examples.korean: the usual media hysteria that surrounds royal visits 발음듣기 늘 그렇듯 왕가의 방문을 두고 언론이 보이는 지나친 흥분 Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: the usual media hysteria that surrounds royal visits 발음
